tika.dc.description:
Sir Gawain, the nephew of King Arthur, was once the most important knight at Arthur's court.Yet as the popularity of the Arthurian romances grew the character of Gawain became increasingly diminished in popular literature. John Matthews, one of the world's leading scholars of Arthurian mythology, explores the phenomenon that influenced the recasting of Gawain from hero to villain, providing a scholarly context through which Gawain's role as the representative of the Goddess upon Earth, the real Green Knight of Camelot and Sovereignty's Champion, may be restored. In addition, the author presents a unique view of the mythology of Britain and its connections with the historical changes that took place over many hundreds of years in the religious and mystical traditions of the country.
